categories.title: Possible
categories.description: Could be related to labor starting, but could also just be discomfort in late pregnancy - it could still be several weeks before baby is here

categories.title: Pre-Labor
categories.description: It could still be several weeks before baby is here Pre-Labor: your body is definitely making changes towards labor - don't be surprised if you meet baby in a week or two

categories.title: Positive
categories.description: Surefire signs of labor coming on! Get ready to welcome your baby in the next day or two

cards.text: Bloody Show
Non-progressing Contractions
Restless Backache
Nesting Urge
Soft Bowel Movements
Progressing Contractions (Longer, Stronger, Closer Together)
Rupture of Membranes (Gush of Fluid)
Leaking Fluid

categories.title: Intake form
categories.description: AFTER you are hired but BEFORE you meet

cards.text: How was your day?
How is work?
Is there anything about your general health or health history that I should know?
Is there anything about this pregnancy/conception that would be helpful for me to know?
Is there anything about previous pregnancies that would be helpful for me to know or that you'd like me to know?
Tell me about your vision for this birth
What are your priorities for this birth?
What do you do for comfort when you are sick or in pain?
What do you think will help most with the pain of labor?
What are you doing to learn about/prepare for labor?
Have you practiced any pain coping techniques in a class or at home??
How do you prefer to learn new things?
What things from your past do you think will help you most in labor?
How have you been learning about parenting (books, videos, family)?
Have you ever been to or seen a birth??
What do you think has helped you most prepare for this birth?
How has this pregnancy been so far?
What has stood out to you about what you have learned about pregnancy/labor/parenting?
What are your concerns or fears about this birth?
Are you planning on joining any new parenting groups?
What kind of parenting support do you have?
Will there be anyone else at your birth? Who are they and how would you like them to participate?
Do you have any special needs I can help with?
Have you ever stayed or been in a hospital before?
How have you coped with stress in the past?
How would you like me to help you in labor?
What are your preferences for pain management?
How do you like to get new information for decision making?
Do you like lots of information, or just the need-to-know stuff?
Do you tend to prefer home remedies or what a doctor recommends?
Do you tend to try to prevent things from going wrong or wait and see how things go before doign something?
When you are are going to take a medicine, do think more about side effects or the good things the medicine will do?
How would you like to be supported when making decisions in labor?
Let's talk about how/when you should contact me?
Let me tell you about my backup arrangements?
Would you like me to take photos at your birth? How modest should those be?
Do you know where to park/get dropped off at your birthplace and how to get in after hours?
Have you written a birth plan?
What would I notice if you were getting overwhelemed?
Do you have a code word for requesting pain medications?
How are visits with your provider going?
How would you like your partner(s) to support you in labor?
How do you function with little sleep? What is your plan for getting sleep when baby arrives?
How do you planning on feeding your baby?
Tell me about your vision for the first minutes, hours, and days with your new baby.
What do you imagine doing at home during early labor?
What kind of help do you have for after the baby is born?
Do you have any concerns about taking care of a new baby?
Do you have any concerns about your recovery period?
How do you feel about touch? Arethere places you do not want to be touched??
What is your plan for siblings/pets while you are in labor?
What foods/drinks do you think will be good in labor?
How much time off from work do you have after the baby arrives?
How much time will your partner/support people have at home with you after baby arrives?
How did you choose your care provider?
Let's talk about the 'what ifs' What would be important to you to experience/feel even if (cesarean, epidural, etc)?
Have you chosen a care provider for your baby?
How do you want to feel after your baby is born?
Have you decided about newborn care procedures (hepatitis B vaccine, erythromycin, vitamin K, bathign baby)??
If there were an emergency, is there anyone you would like me to contact (religious person, family member)?
What do you need to know/hear/do feel good about having a cesarean birth??
What would you need to know/here/do to feel good about being induced?
Partner, how would you like to feel after baby is born?
What else should I kow that we haven't discussed?
If your baby were to need NICU care, who should stay with you and who should go with the baby?
Do you or your partner want to cut the umbilical cord or catch the baby?
